summary: Performance measurement in the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks refers to the systematic evaluation of the efficiency and effectiveness of policies, programs, and projects. It encompasses various methodologies and metrics to assess outcomes against predefined objectives, ensuring accountability and transparency in governance. This concept is pivotal for enhancing management practices within EU institutions, facilitating informed decision-making, and fostering continuous improvement. By establishing clear performance indicators, the EU aims to optimize resource allocation and achieve strategic goals, thereby reinforcing the principles of good governance and public accountability in its regulatory landscape.
